meanings.definition: To perform (work) in a careless or hasty manner.
meanings.sent1: She slubbered through her homework, making many mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The chef slubbered the dish together in a rush, forgetting key ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The cat slubbered around the room, knocking things over in its haste.
meanings.sent4: His speech was slubbered with errors, showing his lack of preparation.
meanings.sent5: The student's slubbered writing was full of scribbles and crossed-out words.

meanings.sent1: He accidentally slubbered paint on the clean canvas.
meanings.sent2: The child slubbered mud on the white carpet, leaving a trail of dirt.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy slubbered paw prints all over the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: The rain slubbered the window, making it difficult to see outside.
meanings.sent5: The artist slubbered the colors together, creating a messy masterpiece.
